intro: Paeonia wendelboi, commonly known as the Wendelboi peony, is a rare and striking perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the芍药科 (Papaveraceae) family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with palmate leaves and sturdy, upright stems. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and its role in the study of plant evolution and taxonomy.
